llm_results: [{"detection_name": "LLM: xss_injection", "detection": "potential", "category": "Injection Attacks", "description": "The GraphQL error message directly reflects the attacker-supplied payload (<script>alert('xss')</script>) back in the JSON response. This is reflected content containing script tags \u2014 a common vector for reflected XSS. While the response is JSON and not HTML (so this alone does not guarantee code execution), any client or front-end that inserts this error message into the DOM without proper escaping/encoding could execute the script. This indicates insufficient handling/sanitization of user input in error messages. Remediation: avoid echoing raw user input in responses, escape/encode error messages before rendering in HTML, and use generic validation/error messages.", "evidence": "Expected value of type \"SearchOptions\", found \"<script>alert('xss')</script>\".", "confidence": 0.8, "llm_analysis": {"is_vulnerable": true, "vulnerability_type": "xss_injection", "severity": "MEDIUM", "confidence": 0.8, "evidence": "Expected value of type \"SearchOptions\", found \"<script>alert('xss')</script>\".", "explanation": "The GraphQL error message directly reflects the attacker-supplied payload (<script>alert('xss')</script>) back in the JSON response. This is reflected content containing script tags \u2014 a common vector for reflected XSS. While the response is JSON and not HTML (so this alone does not guarantee code execution), any client or front-end that inserts this error message into the DOM without proper escaping/encoding could execute the script. This indicates insufficient handling/sanitization of user input in error messages. Remediation: avoid echoing raw user input in responses, escape/encode error messages before rendering in HTML, and use generic validation/error messages."}}]

[{"detection_name": "LLM: html_injection", "detection": "vulnerable", "category": "Injection Attacks", "description": "The GraphQL validation error message contains the raw HTML payload submitted by the client (including an tag with an onerror JavaScript handler). This indicates user-supplied markup is being reflected back in responses without proper sanitization/encoding. If a web client or admin UI displays these error messages inside a page DOM without escaping, the reflected HTML/JS could execute (reflected XSS / HTML injection). The presence of the vector in the response demonstrates a straightforward HTML injection payload was accepted and echoed. Mitigation: ensure server-side encoding/escaping of user input in error messages, avoid embedding raw user input into HTML responses, or return error details in a safe format (e.g., JSON fields that clients must safely render).", "evidence": "Error message reflects input: \"Expected value of type \\\"SearchOptions\\\", found \\\"

If a web client or admin UI displays these error messages inside a page DOM without escaping, the reflected HTML/JS could execute (reflected XSS / HTML injection). The presence of the vector in the response demonstrates a straightforward HTML injection payload was accepted and echoed. Mitigation: ensure server-side encoding/escaping of user input in error messages, avoid embedding raw user input into HTML responses, or return error details in a safe format (e.g., JSON fields that clients must safely render)."}}]
